meanings.def: a short part of a film that is shown separately
examples: Here is a clip from her latest movie.
a clip from a Sherlock Holmes movie
You will see in this clip how well she acts.
The documentary began with a clip from the President's inauguration speech.

meanings.def: a small metal or plastic object used for holding things together or in place
examples: a hair clip
toe clips on a bicycle
She put a clip in her hair.

meanings.def: a piece of jewellery that fastens to your clothes
examples: a diamond clip

meanings.def: the act of cutting something to make it shorter
examples: He gave the hedge a clip.

meanings.def: a quick hit with your hand
examples: She gave him a clip round the ear for being cheeky.

meanings.def: a set of bullets in a metal container that is placed in or attached to a gun for firing

examples: Land prices will rise at a healthy clip.

idioms.idiom: at a fast, good, steady, etc. clip
examples: Land prices will rise at a healthy clip.

meanings.def: to fasten something to something else with a clip; to be fastened with a clip
examples: clip something + adv./prep. He clipped the microphone (on) to his collar.
Clip the pages together.
+ adv./prep. Do those earrings clip on?

meanings.def: to cut something with scissors or shears, in order to make it shorter or neater; to remove something from somewhere by cutting it off
examples: clip something to clip a hedge
clip something from something/off (something) He clipped off a length of wire.
He clipped off a piece of wire with the pliers.
His hair had been clipped as closely as possible to the scalp.
The trees had been clipped into formal shapes.

meanings.def: to hit the edge or side of something
examples: clip something The car clipped the kerb as it turned.
clip something + adv./prep. She clipped the ball into the net.

meanings.def: to cut something out of something else using scissors
examples: to clip a coupon (out of the paper)

meanings.def: to limit a person’s freedom or power
examples: Having a new baby to take care of has clipped her wings.

idioms.def: to limit a person’s freedom or power
examples: Having a new baby to take care of has clipped her wings.
